body:
Apparently, the current spack in the repo is broken on Ubuntu 18.04

Following the turorial fails:

```
git clone https://github.com/spack/spack.git
. spack/share/spack/setup-env.sh
spack install hdf5
```
`git clone https://github.com/spack/spack.git
. spack/share/spack/setup-env.sh
spack install hdf5`

Besides reporting the issue, I have the following questions:

1. What can I do to recover my already compiled modules? I really hate to wait another day to have them compiled again, once downgrade to a working version of spack.
2. Do you plan to start publishing a "stable" version even at the cost of a little outdated module?
title: "spack load" broken with error "bash: /Modules/bin/modulecmd: No such file or directory"
